data.title: Real nice
data.text: Small office set aside for the museum.. Self guided.  It was fun to visit ,my hubby,s father  worked there upstairs  many years ago

data.title: Great historic visit
data.text: This is so cool. I have lived here a long time and never knew there was a postal museum in this old post office. I had also never been inside the post office. This is like walking back in time from the time you open the main door. All of the boxes are the old style boxes. The postal museum is inside the main lobby and has limited hours of operation. The museum is open 11:30 until 3:30 Monday through Friday. It's free and well worth the visit just to see all of the history. As soon as you walk in the door, you feel like you've stepped back in time. There is an old phone, typewriter and mail box. The old postal window is set up just as it would have been many years ago. The history of the post office box is posted next to a replica of the boxes. The post office still uses these style boxes. There is plenty of interesting reading around the room including the history of the Charleston Post office. You can spend time reading all of them. It's a very cool place to visit.

data.title: Great insight into the importance of Postal Delivery
data.text: This museum was filled with lots of artifacts and reproductions that give you great insight into the importance of a functioning post office. It very well-documented the struggle during the Civil War when the change from the United States Post Office to the Confederate states of America post office occurred.

data.title: Small and fun little museum!
data.text: I thoroughly enjoyed walking through this small museum! They have lots of information about the first mail couriers (what they rode and wore in terms of satchels, uniforms, etc.) and have old letters, stamps, and local information about the couriers of Charleston. The vintage typewriter and desk was a nice touch. As a mail courier myself, I was charmed to learn all the information and history they had displayed in different posters and photos on the wall, and I was free and happy that this was open to the public. I wish it was better advertised, but I was glad even the mail couriers of the city enjoy it (one that I met on the street recommended I check it out).

data.title: Interesting Little Museum
data.text: There is quite a bit to see in this little museum within the existing Charleston Post Office.  There were canceling machines, post office boxes, clothing and other items used in the post offices of yesterday.

data.title: Cute little museum
data.text: The postal museum is located at the corner of the South Carolina a Court House. It is not very big no bigger than a bedroom. The little room is filled with postal apparatus. Admission is free and for a reason, but would defiantly check it out.

data.title: Good postal history of SC
data.text: Very nice that they kept a museum in their post office on one of the corners of 4 corners of Broad St. They had the proclamation when the south left the union ; that the Northern stamps would not be honored any more.  THere were Jefferson Davis stamps and other Confederation items. There was a historical presentatin in the large room . Worthwhile for philatelists and for history fanatics.Free.

data.title: Ok
data.text:
Had to go here since I work for the post office. They had a canceling machine I used to use not to long ago. ( 1993). It's a small museum. But for me it was cool. 
Stop here on your trip, there is no fee.

data.title: Surprised
data.text: My wife spotted this free museum as we passed by and we ducked in for a quick look.  The building is surprisingly beautiful, carved wood, polished brass and marble.  The museum contains dressed manniquins, antique furniture, postal machines, stamps, etc.  If you're nearby, definitely stop by for a quick look.

data.title: If you are interested in postal history or stamps, this is for you
data.text: A small but interesting museum -- really a one room exhibit with cases and actual machines, etc. involved in postal history hosued inside an impressive post office building.

data.title: One of the fun free things to do
data.text: My Daddy works for the Post Office, so I definitely wanted to visit the museum.  It's a small area within the actual post office, and from what I can tell, it was free to get in.  That's always a plus for me.  It's near other things like historic churches, so if you pass by or want to take a trip just to see it, I would definitely recommend it.  It's especially good for people who don't want to spend forever in a museum because the collection is small but very interesting!

data.title: The Oldest Continuously Operated Post Office in the Carolinas
data.text:
The Postal Museum on the corner of Meeting and Broad Streets is the oldest continuously operating Post Office in the Carolinas. It has been in operation since 1896.

The Museum is open Monday - Friday 9 AM to 5 PM. The actual Post Office window to mail items is only open Monday - Friday 11:30 AM to 3:30 PM. Great self-guided tour of P.O. history.
